name: MetaSounds Audio System, Mixing Architecture, and Dynamic Radio
oneLiner: Designed a production-style UE5 audio system using Sound Classes, Control Buses, Submixes, and MetaSounds to support dynamic tutorial commentary, a multi-station radio with tuning UI effects, and layered game ambience and SFX.
bulletpoints: Built a structured audio mixing architecture using Sound Classes, Control Buses, Submixes, and Control Bus Mixes to support both global and user settings.
Implemented MetaSounds with event-driven triggers to sequence dynamic tutorial commentary from a variable-length pool, creating non-repeating tutorial flows.
Created an in-game radio system with 7 stations and 45+ tracks, controlled through UI with a radio-tuning effect, plus dedicated start-screen music, ambience, and gameplay SFX.

deepDive.problem: A playable validation executable needed a flexible, production-style audio system that could support dynamic commentary of variable length, user-driven mixing controls, and a radio feature without becoming brittle or hard to extend.
approach: Built a clear audio routing and mixing hierarchy using Sound Classes for categorization, Submixes for routing, and Control Buses/Bus Mixes for runtime level control.
Used parameter patches to combine user settings with global mix behavior, ensuring consistent and scalable control across categories.
Implemented MetaSounds per category with event triggers so Blueprint systems can drive dynamic playback and sequencing reliably.
Designed tutorial commentary as a pool of variable-length segments sequenced via Blueprint-triggered events, producing a different tutorial flow each time while preserving correct pacing.
Created a multi-station radio system (7 stations, 45+ tracks) with UI-driven control and a radio-tuning effect, alongside dedicated start-screen music, ambience, and gameplay SFX.
